model

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.util.Observable
    Board class waarin het bord wordt gemodelleerd.
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Martijn Gemmink en Bas Hendrikse

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Initialiseerd een bord met grootte (HEIGTH*WIDTH) en zet vervolgens alle velden op Mark.EMPTY.

      • isField

        public static boolean isField(int ix)
        Returns true if ix is a valid index of a field on the board.
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= ix < WIDTH*HEIGTH

      • isField

        public static boolean isField(int row,
                              int col)
        Returns true of the (row,col) pair refers to a valid field on the board.
        Returns:
        true if 0 <= row < HEIGTH && 0 <= col < WIDTH

      • isFull

        public boolean isFull()
        Tests if there are no more empty fields on the board.
        Returns:
        true if all fields are occupied

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Returns true if the game is over. The game is over when there is a winner or the board is full.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over

      • hasFourHorizontal

        public boolean hasFourHorizontal(Mark m)

        Returns:

      • isWinner

        public boolean isWinner(Mark m)
        Checks if the mark m has won. A mark wins if it controls at least one row, column or diagonal.
        Parameters:
        m - the mark of interest
        Returns:
        true if the mark has won

      • hasWinner

        public boolean hasWinner()
        Returns true if the game has a winner. This is the case when one of the marks controls at least one row, column or diagonal.
        Returns:
        true if the game has a winner.
